critique: The document establishes a National Defense Executive Reserve, drawing individuals from the civilian economy and government for training in executive positions during emergencies. It centralizes authority under the Director of the Office of Defense Mobilization, who coordinates the program and sets standards. The order emphasizes national security and preparedness, potentially expanding executive power during emergencies. It also includes exemptions for reservists from certain conflict-of-interest statutes, which could be seen as prioritizing efficiency over strict ethical constraints.
